text.section: The Authority consists of nine members appointed by the Governor.
To the extent practicable, members appointed to the Authority shall reasonably reflect the geographic, racial, and gender diversity of the State.

section.section: The term of a member is 2 years.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Authority on October 1, 2010.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member may not be appointed for more than two consecutive full terms.
To the extent practicable, the Governor shall fill any vacancy in the membership of the Authority within 60 days after the vacancy.

text.section: On the recommendation of the Authority, the Governor may remove a member for incompetence or misconduct.
